    Apply Analysis Function to Multiple Imputed Datasets

    analyse2.Rd

    This function applies an analysis function to imputed datasets and stores the results for later pooling. It is designed to work with multiple imputed datasets and apply a given analysis function (e.g., ANCOVA) to each imputation iteration.

    analyse2(
  data = NULL,
  vars = NULL,
  method = NULL,
  fun = rbmi::ancova,
  delta = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    Data frame containing the imputed datasets. The data frame should include a variable that identifies distinct imputation iterations (e.g., IMPID).

    vars

    A character vector specifying the variables of interest. Defaults to NULL.

    method

    Character string specifying the method used for analysis (e.g., "ANCOVA"). Defaults to NULL.

    fun

    Analysis function to be applied to each imputed dataset. Defaults to ancova. Must be a function.

    delta

    A data.frame containing additional information to adjust the analysis or NULL if not needed. Defaults to NULL.

    ...

    Additional arguments passed to the analysis function fun.

    Value

    An object of rbmi class analysis that contains the results from applying the analysis function to each imputed dataset.

    Details

    This function loops through distinct imputation datasets (identified by IMPID), applies the provided analysis function, and stores the results. The fun argument must be a valid function, and delta (if provided) must be either NULL or a data.frame.

    Examples

    # Example usage with an ANCOVA function:
# analyse2(data = imputed_data, fun = ancova)
